data.message: Very amazing but how long can it fly for before it has to come in for refueling....???

replies.message: Great question, Bob. Aquila is solar-powered. You can learn more here: http://bit.ly/29ZEsBi. -Brad
No fuel it's solar
Solar yes but it can only last 3 months per flight
Only?  Lol.
Really,"only", when jet-liners can fly at the most 12 to 14 HOURS.!!
Carry on people....
Solor

Bob here is asking a serous scientific question to which ya'll are responding with sarcasm. Yes 3 months is far longer than what we currently have in relation to planes. But a satellite can stay up far longer, I believe Bob was asking which way it leaned more. Aircraft or spacecraft.

What I am saying is this.......Aquila is still being tested. And right now, it has only flown for 90 minutes which far surpassed the 30 minutes it was supposed fly for. 
Aquila will be able to cover a region of 60 miles in diameter at 60,000ft.
So more of these Aquilas will be needed to cover the 4 billion people who still are not connected.
It will be a fantastic way to cover all those 4 billion people but it will take time. It is not a working project yet.....it is a work still in testing.....but it will be a good thing when more are up flying. There will be needed overlapping flights because it will ONLY last 3 months.
The longest unmanned solar flight lasted 2 weeks and that was NOT Aquila.....that was a test to see how long an unmanned solar flight could stay in flight.
Its still in testing folks...it is not working now.
I read about Aquila in the link provided in this discussion.
Read it, learn about it, and i am done in this discussion......goodbye
Glad they are testing it.
AND SO THE WRIGHT BROTHERS AND ALEXANDER GRAHAM BELL MARCH ON.....YEA.....WHERE WILL IT BE  IN A HUNDRED YEARS ?
